summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 between the FBI Victim Services Division, the Department of Justice Civil Rights Division (CRT), and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) coordinating the distribution of invitations and RSVP questionnaires for a meeting (scheduled for November 12, 2020) with victims/survivors and their attorneys related to the Epstein case. It includes a list of attorneys representing victims.

persons.name: Spencer Kuvin
persons.context: Listed as an attorney for victims; his name was noted as potentially misspelled as 'Kuven' in a prior list.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Listed as an attorney point of contact (POC) for victims; part of the firm Allred Maroko Goldberg.

events.title: Scheduled victim meeting
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for November 12, 2020, for which invitations and RSVP questionnaires were being distributed to victims/survivors and their attorneys by the FBI and DOJ.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division and DOJ were coordinating a meeting with Epstein victims/survivors and their attorneys scheduled for November 12, 2020.
A 'Survivor Master List' was being used to track contact information for victims, with some entries lacking addresses or phone numbers.
Invitations were sent to 14 attorneys (with requests to pass to clients), 6 victims directly, and a family member of a deceased victim.
The document reveals the names of numerous attorneys representing Epstein victims, including Gloria Allred, David Boies, and Spencer Kuvin.
Communication shows inter-agency coordination between the FBI, DOJ Civil Rights Division (CRT), and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) on victim outreach.
